channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Lower nicotine requirements in cigarettes could be coming soon
item.description: The FDA is expected to propose a new rule Wednesday that would mean cigarettes have lower nicotine limits to make them less addictive.
item.content:encoded: The FDA is expected to propose a new rule Wednesday that would mean cigarettes have lower nicotine limits to make them less addictive.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: South Korean President Yoon detained after standoff over martial law decree
item.description: Yoon and his ruling party supporters remain defiant against the insurrection charges. He is South Korea's first sitting president to be detained.
item.content:encoded:
Yoon and his ruling party supporters remain defiant against the insurrection charges. He is South Korea's first sitting president to be detained.

(Image credit: /AP)
item.dc:creator: Se Eun Gong

item.title: Pistachio moguls and reservoirs: False water claims spread about California fires
item.description: Influencers and politicians are spreading false narratives about water and the L.A. wildfires. These include the idea that farm moguls took firefighting water and an empty reservoir is part of a plot.
item.content:encoded:
Influencers and politicians are spreading false narratives about water and the L.A. wildfires. These include the idea that farm moguls took firefighting water and an empty reservoir is part of a plot.

(Image credit: Apu Gomes/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: U.S. watchdog sues Capital One, alleging bank cheated customers out of $2 billion
item.description: The CFPB claims Capital One intentionally kept news of its higher-yield savings accounts from members with lower-yield savings accounts.
item.content:encoded:
The CFPB claims Capital One intentionally kept news of its higher-yield savings accounts from members with lower-yield savings accounts.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Move aside BMI: There's a better way to define obesity, commission finds
item.description: An international committee of scientists has proposed changing the way obesity is defined and diagnosed. The proposal adds more ways to measure body composition and fat.
item.content:encoded: An international committee of scientists has proposed changing the way obesity is defined and diagnosed. The proposal adds more ways to measure body composition and fat.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: Departing DHS Secretary Mayorkas contends he delivered border security in the end
item.description: As DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas prepares to leave office, NPR sits down for an exit interview. He tells us the border is more secure now than before the pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
As DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas prepares to leave office, NPR sits down for an exit interview. He tells us the border is more secure now than before the pandemic.

(Image credit: Shuran Huang for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Milton Guevara

item.title: Photos: Southern California pets receive aid from rescue groups
item.description: A network of rescue groups are caring for animals affected by wildfires still burning in the Los Angeles area. A multi-state operation is under way to help relieve local animal shelters.
item.content:encoded:
A network of rescue groups are caring for animals affected by wildfires still burning in the Los Angeles area. A multi-state operation is under way to help relieve local animal shelters.

(Image credit: Ryan Kellman)
item.dc:creator: Elise Hu

item.title: Safety advocates fear Tesla will face less accountability for car crashes under Trump
item.description: With Tesla CEO Elon Musk backing President-elect Donald Trump, safety advocates fear the incoming administration is poised to scrap a federal crash reporting requirement that Tesla calls unfair.
item.content:encoded:
With Tesla CEO Elon Musk backing President-elect Donald Trump, safety advocates fear the incoming administration is poised to scrap a federal crash reporting requirement that Tesla calls unfair.

(Image credit: Washington State Patrol)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Trump's Cabinet pick for attorney general is Pam Bondi. Here's what to know
item.description: Bondi is expected to receive broad support from Republicans but face sharp questions from Democrats who have concerns about whether she will protect the Justice Department from political influence.
item.content:encoded:
Bondi is expected to receive broad support from Republicans but face sharp questions from Democrats who have concerns about whether she will protect the Justice Department from political influence.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Trump will begin his presidency in delicate position, poll finds
item.description: A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows that Americans' support for President-elect Donald Trump's top priorities is split, despite his claims of a mandate for his agenda.
item.content:encoded:
A new NPR/PBS News/Marist poll shows that Americans' support for President-elect Donald Trump's top priorities is split, despite his claims of a mandate for his agenda.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro
